title: Defiant Adele fearlessly blacklisted anyone who questioned her weight before '3st loss'
text:

Adele said she's traded "tears" for "sweat" as she showed off her dramatically slimmed-down figure at Drake's birthday party on Wednesday.

Wearing a waist-hugging off-the-shoulder velvet dress, the 31 year old proudly unveiled her weight loss, which is believed to be the result of a diet and fitness overhaul.

Some have accused her of going all Hollywood, claiming that her friendship with actress Jennifer Lawrence has put paid to the chain-smoking, wine chugging Londoner we all knew and loved.

But the stunning star has never been one to seek approval - from friends or otherwise - having resolutely refused to conform to unattainable body standards ever since she emerged on the scene in 2008.

(Image: Hulton Archive)

"I have never been insecure, ever, about how I look, about what I want to do with myself," the spaghetti hoop-loving star told the Daily Mail in 2009 after winning two Grammys.

When she first started out, Tottenham-born Adele lived in a flat with her mum and kicked off her day with a sugary "PG Tips and a fag."

But while her voice won her rave reviews, it was her weight that attracted a constant stream of questions in interviews - to her annoyance, quite rightly.

"I can’t be a product; no one can do that to me. I have all the say; I have power over everything I do," she told the Daily Mail in 2009.

"I have never been insecure, ever, about how I look, about what I want to do with myself. My mum told me to only ever do things for myself, not for others."

And when Chanel's creative director Karl Lagerfeld branded her a "little too fat" in 2012, Adele hit back, insisting she was "very proud" of her looks.

“I’d lose weight if I was an actress and had to play a role where you’re supposed to be 40lb lighter, but weight has nothing to do with my career," the no-nonsense star told People magazine.

She even blacklisted those who tried to suggest as much, revealing, “Even when I was signing a ­contract, most of the industry knew if anyone ever dared say, ‘Lose weight’ to me, they wouldn’t be working with me.”

But after a health scare in 2011, she began making lifestyle changes to protect her voice - and her weight began to fall.

She ditched her 10 daily cups of sugary tea and waved goodbye to alcohol, cigarettes, caffeine all "spicy, citrusy, and tangy" foods.

(Image: Getty)

"It's f***ing boring, but I don't think you take your voice seriously until you've an accident," she told Australia's 60 Minutes of her 2011 vocal hemorrhage.

"I'm frightened all the time I'm going to damage my voice," she admitted.

In 2016 she shed yet more weight ahead of her tour in a bid to "get some stamina".

"Now I fit into normal, off-the-shelf clothes, which is a really big problem for me," she proudly told Vogue.

By 2017 she was believed to have lost more than two stone, reportedly due to The Sirtfood Diet, which sees slimmers fill up on plant-based foods like kale, buckwheat, green tea and tumeric.

(Image: Getty)

The foods are known as sirtuin activators, and are said to control the way the body processes fat and sugar and regulate the appetite in the process.

Green tea and cocoa powder are also on the menu, along with red wine and cheese.

"The Sirtfood Diet is all about losing weight and feeling fantastic through eating great-tasting food," a source told the Daily Mail.

"It's based on extensive research into the power of key plant foods, which when added to our diet turn on fat burning and improve wellbeing."

(Image: Adele/Twitter)

Now believed to be dating Grime artist Skepta, 37, the slender mother-of-one is believed to have turned to reformer pilates to transform her body yet again in the space of just six months.

According to The Sun, she's been taking classes alongside good friend Ayda Field - who's married to Robbie Williams - and has seen some dramatic results, losing more than a stone.

"She has been loving her new workout regime and it really works for her," a source told newspaper.

"It’s a bonus that she has shifted some weight. Her mates are glad she’s letting loose and there’s nothing but good feelings towards her. She’s got a new lease of life."

But despite Adele's dedication, she has refreshingly admitted that she will never, ever, relish going to the gym.

“I mainly moan. I’m not, like, skipping to the f-cking gym. I don’t enjoy it," she told Rolling Stone in 2016.

(Image: Sourced from Instagram)

(Image: Twitter/Elizabeth Lauren)

"I do like doing weights. I don’t like looking in the mirror. Blood vessels burst on my face really easily, so I’m so conscious when I’m lifting weights not to let them burst in my face. And if I don’t tour, you’ll catch me back down at the Chinese!”

And as for claims that her best mate Jennifer Lawrence has inspired her "Hollywood makeover", a source previously told The Sun: “People change, and Adele is very happy with where her life is going. She has new friends and new inspirations and there is nothing wrong with that.

“If people have a problem with her dressing well and looking after her health, I really don’t know what to say to them.”
description: Inspirational Adele made it clear from the start that she would be no-one's 'product', thank you very much
